caption:
The photograph captures a serene outdoor scene, prominently featuring a calm body of water with varying shades of green and blue. The texture of the water surface is smooth, reflecting subtle ripples and patches of aquatic vegetation visible underneath. The foreground is dominated by this tranquil and expansive water body.

In the background, on the other side of the water, there’s a gently sloping hill covered with shrubs and sparse vegetation that suggests a semi-arid or Mediterranean climate. A road runs along the top of this hill, where a blue and white train is visible, adding a sense of motion and human activity to the otherwise natural landscape. Adjacent to the train, street lamps and what appear to be power lines stretch across, aligning parallel to the road and the railway. The hill’s foliage is a mixture of greens, yellows, and browns indicating either the season or the arid nature of the environment.

The sky above is clear and bright, which suggests it is possibly midday or early afternoon. There is a warm tone to the lighting, enhancing the vividness of the landscape's natural and artificial elements. This combination of tranquility and gentle human activity offers a balanced and peaceful scene.
title: Botaquito lagoon, is one of the last few Bodies of water of this type in the southern part of the state.  It suffers from nearby freeways and developments as well as farm erosion and septic tank seePage.  Some 84 percent of the state's residents live within 30 miles of the coast, and it has resulted in increased land use pressures coastal wetlands totaled about 125,000 acres in the early 1970's compared to 381,000 acres in 1900
